item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates Incredible Umbreon Painting Based on TCG Card
item.description:
Highlights

  • Umbreon's unique evolution process and striking appearance have made it a beloved Pokemon in the franchise community.
  • A talented fan created an impressive painting based on the Umbreon VMAX TCG card, showcasing their love for the Pokemon.
  • The Umbreon VMAX Secret Rare Alternate Art card is highly coveted by fans, with prices ranging from $899 to $8,000 for pristine condition.

A talented Pokemon fan has made a painting of Umbreon based on one of its most popular TCG cards, achieving an impressive result. Over the years of the franchise, Pokemon fans have met hundreds of charismatic critters, but few have won the hearts of the audience like the Eeveelutions. Each Eevee variant has a different appearance and set of abilities based on how Pokemon trainers decide to evolve the creature.

One of these Eeveelutions is Umbreon, a Pokemon that fans met in Gen 2. While Eevee unlocks new forms when trainers use a evolution stone , the process to turn it into Umbreon is different. Eevee evolves into Umbreon when it has maximum friendship, and it levels up at night. With this, the Pokemon gains black fur symbolizing the night, and yellow eyes that glow when the Pokemon is exposed to the moon's aura. Umbreon is a much-loved Eevelution in the Pokemon community, as evidenced by a talented fan has produced some incredible artwork based on it.

Related
Pokemon Fan Creates Impressive Shadowbox Umbreon Card
An artistic Pokemon lover shares a look at a beautiful handcrafted Umbreon shadowbox card that they made, and fellow fans are asking for more.

Reddit user painting_withLiv23 made a painting based on the Umbreon TCG card known as Umbreon VMAX Secret Rare Alternate Art. According to the fan, they made the painting as a gift for a friend whose favorite card is the Umbreon VMAX TCG card, even though they don't have a physical copy of the card. As a result, the OP produced a beautiful rendition of the popular Pokemon card that depicts Dynamax Umbreon on top of a tower, with the Pokemon trying to "boop" the moon.

How Special is the Umbreon VMAX Pokemon Card?

The Umbreon VMAX Secret Rare Alternate Art card has been one of the most coveted by Pokemon fans in recent years. Released in 2021 as part of Evolved Skies, the seventh expansion of the Pokemon Sword and Shield era , Umbreon VMAX is illustrated by Keiichiro Ito. This card is one of the most expensive of the Gen 8 expansions, and it's not hard to find it for sale on eBay for prices ranging from $899 to almost $8,000 for a card like this in pristine condition.

With decades of existence, Pokemon continues to unite fans in different ways, who form friendships and express their love for the franchise with a lot of creativity. The painting created by painting_withLiv23 is one example, as they decided to use their skills to present their friend with the artwork of one of Eevee's ever-popular evolutions , showing that although Pokemon was introduced so many years ago, fans still have great affection for it.

item.title: Indie Game Beats Fallout 4 and Baldur's Gate 3 as Most-Played Steam Deck Game in April
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stardew Valley surpasses Fallout 4 on Steam Deck, thanks to 1.6 update availability.
  • Fallout franchise popularity spike not enough to dethrone Stardew Valley in April.
  • Variety of AAA and indie games on Steam Deck show diverse player preferences.

Valve has revealed its most-played games on the Steam Deck handheld device, and the mega-hits Fallout 4 and Baldur's Gate 3 both got surpassed by indie darling Stardew Valley . This follows on the heels of Stardew Valley achieving first place on the Steam Deck for March .

The Steam Deck isn't the only mobile platform that Stardew Valley is playable on. The game is also on the Nintendo Switch and mobile devices, giving players plenty of options. However, a big part of the reason Stardew Valley is leading the charts on the Steam Deck regardless is because the 1.6 update can be played on it, whereas all consoles and mobile devices are still waiting for its launch.

Related
Stardew Valley Player Makes Helpful Discovery After 250 Hours
A Stardew Valley player shares a discovery they only found after 250 hours in the game, which could be helpful for some fans to know.

Even taking the 1.6 update into consideration, Stardew Valley 's placement on this chart is impressive. The Fallout franchise saw a massive bump in popularity recently due to the release of the Amazon Prime Fallout TV series, and it shows here, with Fallout 3 , 4 , New Vegas , and even Fallout 76 all making the top 20 for April, while only Fallout 4 narrowly made the list for March. Despite Fallout 4 's next-gen update, it wasn't able to surpass Stardew Valley. However, between breaking the game's mods and Steam Deck Fallout 4 graphics options disappearing with its launch, some players may have avoided it, as well.

Belatro , a roguelike poker-themed game managed to outperform Baldur's Gate 3 , Helldivers 2 , and Elden Ring , among other major hitters. Rockstar Games saw GTA 5 and Red Dead Redemption 2 made the list, CD Projekt Red's Cyberpunk 2077 and The Witcher 3 made the cut, and a number of indie titles were heavily played, including The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth , Hades , and Slay the Spire . The array of games shows that gamers enjoy using the Steam Deck for visually demanding modern AAA games and less graphically complex titles alike.

How Will Steam Deck Game Popularity Shift?

For now, it remains to be seen if there will be a major shakeup of the results for May, but it's possible. Fallout 's major spike in players was largely thanks to Fallout 4' s update and the release of the TV series, which landed on April 25 and April 10, respectively. For the games to rise this far on the list with only a portion of the month contributing to their popularity boost, it's highly likely that a Fallout game will take the crown in May.

However, Baldur's Gate 3 could be a strong competitor in the months to come. Baldur's Gate 3 's Patch 7 is in development and slated to release later this year. The update will add new improved evil path endings, bug fixes, and mod tools, giving players a way to alter the game as they see fit. How Stardew Valley fares against these AAA titles in the coming months will be revealed in time.

item.title: Starfield Fans Are Loving the New Update
item.description:
Highlights

  • Starfield Update 4 on Steam Beta has reinvigorated fans, addressing FPS issues and adding a new Extreme difficulty setting.
  • Ship customization expands to interior design, surface maps are updated, and inventory management is improved in the May update.
  • The positive player reception comes ahead of the Shattered Space DLC launch.

Starfield Update 4, which launched in Steam Beta on May 1, seems to have finally satisfied a lot of fans who had previously abandoned Bethesda's outer space RPG. After a lackluster player reception at launch, fan reaction to this newest Starfield update seems to be overwhelmingly positive.

Bethesda released Starfield in September 2023, and it registered a huge number of players at launch, thanks in no small part to its day-one inclusion on Game Pass. However, it also had to compete with the console launch of Baldur's Gate 3 , which Larian Studios released on PlayStation 5 on the same day. Since then, Starfield 's player numbers have dwindled dramatically, while its competitor's RPG has racked up countless awards, including Game of the Year at The Game Awards 2023.

Related
Starfield Secretly Dropped a Big Hint for Shattered Space DLC
Starfield fans have noticed a small hint pointing toward which faction the RPG's upcoming Shattered Space DLC may be centered around.

But now, fans seem to be resuming their outer space adventures for a lot of reasons, with one of the biggest being the ability to choose between performance and visual modes, dramatically improving the poor FPS rate in Starfield that players had complained about in past builds. Many Starfield players on Reddit have admitted that they left the game in its launch month after around 30 to 40 hours of playtime, but they're now coming back to the game thanks to the improvements included in the update. Players are also praising Bethesda for its inclusion of the new Extreme difficulty setting, offering a greater challenge for fans who found the combat too easy.

More Big Changes Are Coming To Starfield

Those aren't the only major changes the game has undergone with the May update. Ship customization in Starfield has long been one of its strongest selling points, and the May update is expanding that system by allowing players to fully furnish and customize the interior of their ships the same way that they can with their terrestrial outposts, including new empty ship hab modules that are entirely customizable. Other improvements include updated surface maps that display terrain and structures, better inventory management, and improved gameplay options, which include changing the amount of credits carried by vendors.

The recent upswing in Starfield 's player approval couldn't have come at a better time for Bethesda. The Shattered Space DLC is planned for release this autumn, and while director Todd Howard and his team have remained tight-lipped about just what's coming in the game's first major content update other than that it will expand upon the main story keeping fans' interest high ahead of the DLC's launch is likely a major goal for Bethesda Game Studios. While the update is currently only available in Steam Beta, it is planned to be released on all platforms on May 15.

item.title: World of Warcraft Fans Notice New Feature on The War Within Warbands Character Select Screen
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fans can choose 4 characters to appear around a campfire on the updated World of Warcraft login screen in The War Within.
  • Characters may randomly sit, suggesting random emotes could happen.
  • Future updates may bring more backgrounds and features like Follower Dungeons for players to enjoy.

World of Warcraft fans have begun noticing their characters sitting on the Warbands character select screen in The War Within alpha. Though a seemingly innocuous change, World of Warcraft players are excited to see what this new life breathed into the login screen could mean for the future.

Warbands are a new feature coming in World of Warcraft: The War Within that will revolutionize how players approach the game. In addition to tons of alt-friendly adjustments to make many aspects of the game account-wide, the character select screen is getting an overhaul that includes a function where fans can select four of their favorite characters to pose together.

Related
World of Warcraft Reveals Patch Notes for Final Dragonflight Update Ahead of Release
World of Warcraft reveals the update notes for Dragonflight Patch 10.2.7, Dark Heart the final batch of content before The War Within starts.

However, during World of Warcraft: The War Within alpha , some fans noticed a fun detail about this new character select screen. Initially, the characters on this special login screen just idly stood around. That said, some testers have noticed their characters have begun sitting around the campfire instead. WoW content creators Taliesin & Evitel and MrGM discovered their characters taking a load off, proving it was not just a fluke or glitch.

The New Character Select Screen in WoW: The War Within

  • Players can choose up to four favorites from among their roster of World of Warcraft characters to appear around a shared campfire space on their login screen.
  • Fans have noticed their characters sitting occasionally, suggesting they may randomly emote at times.
  • Only one background is available at launch, but WoW may add more for fans to collect in the future.

When World of Warcraft first showed off Warbands at BlizzCon last year, the mocked-up image for the new loading screen showed four characters dynamically posed around a campfire. The alpha version of the character select screen was a bit less exciting, but the spark of life in the form of randomly sitting down around the fire shows that World of Warcraft is still adding more things to the feature. Players are wondering what other emotes they might eventually spy around their campfire, and hope their characters might eventually be able to dance and laugh together.

The new Warbands system may have even more new features in the future as well. World of Warcraft has hinted at new backgrounds that fans could collect and use for their Warbands, and WoW executive producer Holly Longdale teased completing Follower Dungeons with ones own alts. Warbands are one of the most exciting new features coming in The War Within , and watching World of Warcraft evolve it in real time is likely to delight players in the new expansion.

item.title: Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night Getting a Surprise Update 5 Years After Launch
item.description:
Highlights

  • Update 1.5 for Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night brings new multiplayer modes and cosmetic packs on May 9.
  • The game, a successful Kickstarter project, is praised for its Metroidvania-style gameplay and 2.5D graphics.
  • Chaos Mode offers cooperative gameplay, while Versus Mode introduces a competitive PVP experience.

The studio behind 2019s Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night has just released the surprising news that a massive update is headed to the game next week. Update 1.5 will bring new cosmetic packs and two new multiplayer game modes to Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night .

Developed by ArtPlay, an indie developer led by former Castlevania series producer Koji Igarashi, Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night is the product of one of the most successful Kickstarter projects in gaming history. The crowdfunding campaign raised more than $5.5 million, over 11 times its original goal, and the retro platformer has since sold over 2 million copies. Set in 18th-century England, the player controls the orphaned Miriam as she battles through a demon-infested castle to cleanse herself of an alchemists curse.

Related
Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night Sequel Confirmed
ArtPlay and 505 Games officially confirm a Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night sequel is currently in the early stages of development.

Heralded as the spiritual successor to Castlevania: Symphony of the Night due to its rewarding Metroidvania-style gameplay and stylish 2.5D graphics, Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night has received multiple updates over its five-year lifespan. While previous patches have added additional playable characters and single-player experiences, ArtPlays latest development roadmap shows that one of the biggest updates yet is just around the corner. Update 1.5 will launch on May 9 for PC, PlayStation, and Xbox, and May 16 for Nintendo Switch. Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night s final free content update will feature two multiplayer modes and a free cosmetic pack. Miriams appearance will be further customizable with three premium cosmetic packs featuring multiple unique clothing items and weapons, each with upgradeable stats.

Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night Roadmap Details

  • May 9: Update 1.5 releases on PC, PlayStation and Xbox, adding two new multiplayer modes, plus one free and three paid cosmetics packs.
  • May 16: Update 1.5 releases on Nintendo Switch.
  • TBA: Classic II: Dominiques Curse Premium DLC, a retro paid expansion with a brand-new story on an even bigger map.

Chaos Mode, the first new game type coming to the acclaimed dark gothic fantasy adventure , will allow two players to team up against demonic hordes of enemies and bosses in a cooperative battle for survival. Powerful upgrades can be earned by completing challenges as players battle through a series of randomized encounters. Meanwhile, Versus Mode will provide a competitive counterpart in a special PVP mode created just for Ritual of the Night . Two players will battle waves of demons in separate arenas, earning souls to spend on more powerful weapons and armor as they attempt to outlast their opponent. Players can also purchase unique abilities to interfere with their rivals, such as filling their room with fog and reversing their controls. Both multiplayer game variants support local play and online matchmaking on the same system, but neither will support cross-platform play.

ArtPlay also revealed that a subsequent expansion is in development. Classic II: Dominiques Curse will be a premium DLC featuring the same retro-gameplay as Classic Mode but with a bigger map and its own canon storyline. The studio also announced it will soon start working on the physical PC version of the game, the final Kickstarter reward to be delivered. Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night was recently added to Game Pass , meaning Xbox players have time to practice before the multiplayer update goes live next week.
